testSteps.description: Making a call to the contact

assertions.text: The users sees only the call button in the chat screen and it doesn't change when the user types the message. Make sure that when the call is made, the screen is changed to the call screen

evidence.description: User enters 'Me' chat. At the bottom of the screen, standard message input controls are visible including a camera icon, microphone icon, and a '+' button, but no dedicated call button is prominently displayed in the message composition area.
User begins typing 'Hello test message!' in the text input field. The keyboard is active and the message input area shows the typed text.

As the user types, a green send button (circular with arrow icon) appears on the right side of the message input field, replacing the previous interface state. This directly contradicts the assertion that the interface 'doesn't change when the user types.'

The message 'Hello test message!' is sent and appears in the chat thread under 'Today' section at 11:10 PM with a checkmark indicating successful delivery. The send button is no longer visible after sending.
User returns to the main Chats list view. The 'Me' chat shows the sent message 'You: Hello test message!' at 11:10 PM. No call screen transition is observed in the recording.

assertions.explanation: The assertion states that 'the user sees only the call button in the chat screen and it doesn't change when the user types the message.' However, the recording clearly shows that when the user opens a chat (at t=3s) and types a message 'Hello test message!' (t=4-11s), the interface changes from showing a call button to showing a send button (green circular button with an arrow/send icon) at t=5s onwards. This contradicts the assertion that the interface 'doesn't change when the user types the message.' Additionally, no call is made in this recording, so the second part of the assertion (about the screen changing to a call screen) cannot be verified.
